title: Trimester Review & The Future of Fintech

sections.title: Grammatical Consolidation
sections.content:
This trimester, we have built a solid foundation for financial communication. Here is a review of the key structures:

1. **Present Simple**: Used for bank routines and permanent states. (*I work in the compliance department.*)
2. **Past Simple (Was/Were)**: Used for past financial states. (*The interest rates were lower last year.*)
3. **Comparatives & Superlatives**: Used to compare products. (*Neobanks are faster than traditional banks.*)
4. **Must / Mustn't**: Essential for security and compliance. (*You must never share your OTP.*)
5. **Future (Going to / Present Continuous)**: For financial intentions and fixed plans. (*We are launching the app next Monday.*)
6. **Present Perfect**: For financial experiences and durations with 'for' and 'since'. (*I have held this portfolio for three years.*)

sections.title: Core Fintech Vocabulary Review
sections.content:
We have covered the entire digital finance ecosystem:

- **Digital Onboarding**: Biometrics, KYC, Neobanks.
- **Daily Operations**: Transfers, POS, Statements, NFC.
- **Security & Safety**: Phishing, 3D Secure, Virtual Cards, OTP.
- **Credit & Lending**: BNPL, Installments, Credit Score, APR.
- **Wealth Management**: ETFs, Robo-advisors, Diversification, Yield.

sections.title: Future Trends in Finance
sections.content:
The world of finance continues to evolve quickly. To stay competitive, you should be familiar with these emerging concepts:

- **AI-Driven Personalization**: Banks using AI to give you custom financial advice.
- **Open Banking**: Sharing your financial data securely between different apps to get better services.
- **DeFi (Decentralized Finance)**: Financial services that operate without traditional middle-men like banks.
- **Green Fintech**: Investing and banking products that focus on environmental sustainability.
